communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

PLEASE PROVIDE THE RADIO TRANSMISSIONS, THE DASH CAM VIDEO ALONG WITH THE BODY CAM VIDEO, Arrest Report, memos, texts, emails, or any electronic message, written message, memo, letter, or other documents relating to the arrest of Sarah Elizabeth (Ortiz-Abreu) Summers DOB 04/29/1990 arrested on 01/29/2025 in Concho County for Burglary of a Habitation, and Unauthorized Use of a Vehicle.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

title: ATTN: FOIA request from Business Insider

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-- Copies of any and all communications, including emails, email attachments, text messages, voicemails, and memos, held by the Department of Veterans Affairs referencing the Department of Government Efficiency’s “DOGE” access to agency data systems and records
-- The list of Department of Government Efficiency “DOGE” employees with a “@va.gov” email domain

Please provide records from 01/20/25 through the date this request is processed.

For reference, according to news reports, VA leaders confirmed that they're working with DOGE officials for purposes of "identifying wasteful contracts, improving VA operations and strengthening management of the department's IT projects." Please make sure to provide names and contact info for those DOGE officials: https://www.militarytimes.com/veterans/2025/02/06/va-leaders-working-with-doge-but-say-veterans-personal-info-is-secure/ 

I would like these records in electronic format, transmitted via email or other digital method; please refrain from sending paper copies of the records.

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please waive any applicable fees; this information is being sought for reporting purposes. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me by telephone if you have questions regarding this request. If I can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me directly at 714-833-8487.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicole Einbinder

title: ATTN: FOIA request from Business Insider

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-- Copies of any and all communications, including emails, email attachments, text messages, voicemails, and memos, held by the Social Security Administration referencing the Department of Government Efficiency’s “DOGE” access to agency data systems and records
-- The list of Department of Government Efficiency “DOGE” employees with a “@ssa.gov” email domain

Please provide records from 01/20/25 through the date this request is processed.

For reference, according to news reports, SSA is "an upcoming focus of the Department of Government Efficiency": https://www.semafor.com/article/02/06/2025/inside-doges-march-with-the-social-security-administration-soon-to-come 

For reference, President Trump said that DOGE may be given access to SSA to take undocumented immigrants off federal benefits lists: https://www.politico.com/news/2025/02/07/trump-musk-pentagon-education-014337 

I would like these records in electronic format, transmitted via email or other digital method; please refrain from sending paper copies of the records.
 
If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.
 
Please waive any applicable fees; this information is being sought for reporting purposes. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me by telephone if you have questions regarding this request. If I can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me directly at 714-833-8487.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicole Einbinder

title: Request to DoD for all communications with documentary filmmaker Jake Rademacher

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to DoD for all communications with documentary filmmaker Jake Rademacher
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications between the Department of Defense (DoD) and documentary filmmaker Jake Rademacher (director of "Brothers at War" and "Brothers after War"), within the 20-year record retention schedule for such records (as specified on p. 202 of the May 2022 DoD document titled "Records Disposition Schedules," Record Group 303). Such communications may include, but should not be limited to, emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls. I specifically request a search of the entertainment liaison offices and other public relations offices.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Marines support for 2009 documentary "Brothers at War"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Marines support for 2009 documentary "Brothers at War"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the U.S. Marine Corps and the production of the 2009 documentary "Brothers at War" directed by Jake Rademacher. I request any and all documents pertaining to Marines support for "Brothers at War." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the Marines and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Brothers at War," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the Hollywood actor Gary Sinise (born Gary Alan Sinise on March 17, 1955, in Blue Island, Illinois), within the 20-year record retention schedule for such records (as specified on p. 202 of the May 2022 DoD document titled "Records Disposition Schedules," Record Group 303). Such communications may include, but should not be limited to, emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls. I specifically request a search of the entertainment liaison offices and other public relations offices.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding NIH Project number R01MH123746 "The impact of pubertal suppression on adolescent neural and mental health trajectories"

-- A copy of the initial grant application submitted to the NIH including ALL appendices

-- A copy of the resubmitted grant application submitted to the NIH including ALL appendices

-- All FCOI reports to NIH for this project

-- All Progress reports related to this study

-- NIH Board meeting minutes for discussion and approval of this grant and all other board meeting minutes related to this grant 

-- a copy of the informed consent forms required to be signed by participants and/or parents or guardians (NOT any completed form -- just a copy of the blank forms given to participants)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Laidlaw

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Strategic Communication Overview
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Briefing titled "Strategic Communication Overview", presented by Sue Gough, Acting Director of Joint Communication, DASD (JC), OSD Public Affairs, on July 29, 2009.

This briefing is cited in ADA525371, "Commander’s Handbook for Strategic Communication and Communication Strategy", published June 24, 2010.

Please provide a copy of the presentation slides and any associated written materials. If no slides exist, I request any available summary, memorandum, or transcript related to the briefing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bill Gagnon
